activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:34 AM Defendant Gerald Leon Cole appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier appeared by video for Gerald Leon Cole.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea on behalf of Defendant. Matter referred to Judge Kuglitsch for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:47 PM  Intern Verity Altenberger by video supervised by Noah Tylenda by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gerald Leon Cole appeared by phone. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address and date of birth confirmed, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant did not qualify for public defender.  Defendant to hire and attorney or file a petition for appointment of attorney.  Signature bond of $1000 set.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with J.B.  Defendant must sign bond by the end of the day on August 5, 2022.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
